useCase.name: Image Capture and Analysis
useCase.description: UAV collects imagery using an onboard camera and analyzes that imagery in real-time to identify specific objects and raise detection events.

preconditions.precondition: The UAV is in the air.
The UAV has a functioning RGB or thermal camera.
The UAV has a trained vision model onboard that is capable of detecting objects of interest.
The videostream server is active and the UAV is registered with the videostream server.

successEndConditions.condition: The UAV detects and annotates objects of interest within the region of interest at high degrees of accuracy (metric needed).
Annotated video is streamed to the videostream server.

failureEndConditions.condition: Target objects within the UAV's field of view are not detected.

useCase.trigger: The UAV receives a command to collect and analyze imagery.

mainSequence.step: If the camera is not activated, the UAV activates it.
Whilst in flight, the UAV streams imagery to its onboard companion computer.
Onboard compute processes streamed imagery and annotates objects of interest to depict their bounding boxes and confidence scores.
When an object is detected with confidence greater than the current [VisionDetection_Threshold] value, an event is raised and forwarded to the DroneResponse Event Manager.
All collected image streams (with and without annotations) are transmitted to the videostream server.
Steps 2-5 are continually repeated until the UAV is commanded to stop collecting imagery.

esteps.description: At anytime that the camera's battery supply is depleted, the UAV raises an alert.
esteps.step: The UAV raises an alert notifying the operator of the camera's battery depletion.
